Pre-Game Insights: The Botswana men’s football national team, known as the Zebras, will take on Cape Verde in crucial Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) 2025 qualifying matches, with the first match set for October 10, 2024, at 16:00.
The Zebras have had a challenging campaign so far, losing their opening two matches and are under pressure to secure a win against Cape Verde.
Football analyst Jimmy George expressed concerns about the team's performance and the inactivity of captain Thatayaone Ditlhokwe, who has struggled for playing time at Kaizer Chiefs.
Botswana’s head coach Didier Gomes Da Rosa has named a provisional 25-man squad featuring both local talent and international experience.
Others: The squad showcases a blend of domestic players and those competing internationally, such as Ditlhokwe and Seakanyeng, who play in South Africa and Morocco, respectively.
